headline: Instant Pot Chicken Risotto
description: Once you see how easy it is to make chicken risotto in an Instant Pot you'll never make it any other way.
name: Instant Pot Chicken Risotto
recipeIngredient: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as an Instant Pot), and select Saute function on normal setting according to manufacturer's instructions.
Mix oregano, thyme, paprika, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Season chicken with spice blend.

Heat 1 tablespoon butter and olive oil in the pressure cooker until butter is melted. Quickly brown chicken on all sides, about 3 minutes. Remove chicken. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Remove onion and garlic from the pot.

Melt a second tablespoon of butter in the pot, add rice, and stir constantly until fully coated and toasted, about 3 minutes. Pour in wine and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom with a wooden spoon. Cook until wine is absorbed and alcohol cooks off, about 2 minutes. Add chicken stock, chicken, and onion mixture to the pot; mix until well combined. Turn off Saute function.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions, and set timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Stir Parmesan cheese and remaining tablespoon of butter into the risotto. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with chopped parsley, and serve.

review.reviewBody: I've never made risotto before. I really enjoyed how it turned out. I combined the mushroom recipe with this one and it was very nice. I used about half as many mushrooms as that recipe called for. Over a cup. After I sautéed the chicken, I cooked the mushrooms and added the onions and then garlic. I followed this recipe from there. I cheated a ½ cup of the 4½ cups of broth and used water. I rarely finish a whole carton of broth before it goes bad. I will definitely make this again and try other risotto recipes too.
By far my favorite risotto. But why doesn't it show up in the iPhone app? I have to go to the website to find it in my favorites.
Easy, good but kind of bland. We added a lot more pepper!
Great

I’d give this 10 stars if I could! So good, and my family all loved it! I doubled the chicken (and doubled coating spices) and threw in a cup of frozen peas and carrots when I added the chicken back in. Flavorful, creamy, delicious!

This was the first time our family has tried risotto. It was very good and will be added to our regular rotation. I made it without the white wine, cut the thyme to 1/8tsp, increased the garlic and parmesan. I'm not a big fan of thyme, so next time I'm not going to use it at all

I made this and it was good, however, not nearly enough chicken. I would double the recipe amount. I also feel like it needed color and would suggest carrots and or peas. We served it with garlic bread, which was a nice touch.

This recipe was great as far as texture- the risotto was perfect, creamy and rich with the cheese added. It cooked perfectly at the times listed. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars was the amount of time it took to prep and the lack of flavor! There needs to be a definite increase in the spices and I used a double strength chicken broth. I'm not sure what would have happened had I used regular, but it wouldn't have helped. So, if you are great with spicing things up to your taste, this would be great. If you are more of a beginning cook, this might be a little too much of a challenge without additional spices broken down in the recipe.
Delicious. I never made risotto because of the constant need to watch it. A definite to make again.
Absolutely delicious!
Delicious! Very easy to make. Did not have white wine so added an additional 1/2c of chicken stock
Simple and delicious

Even considering my culinary ineptitude and substitutions -- no wine, so beer it was -- this really turned out to be a delish dish. Next time -- and that will be soon! -- I'll try a little less Parmesan. Thank you lutzflcat.
This was very easy to make and the risotto came out perfectly! The chicken was also very moist. I would add a little more flavor when I make it again next time.
I stuck with the original recipe. I really liked it. I can see adding mushrooms would be good. I’ll be making this again.
added frozen spinach and mushrooms. cut rice and liquids in 1/2. really delicious.
Big hit with the family and it's simple to prepare.

This was some of the best risotto I’ve ever had. It had the perfect creamy texture, chicken was tender, and flavor was delicious! My whole family enjoyed it. I didn’t change a thing. This recipe is a keeper.

Best Risotto dish I've ever had. i used ground turkey that you can brown in the pot on saute. Also added a can of petite tomatoes and mushrooms. So good. This will go on our weekly list of must haves!
This was REALLY good. My only tweaks were adding a small container of mushrooms, adding 1 extra cup of broth, and a sprig of rosemary. Definitely a keeper!

I'm going to preface this review with the statement that I have never tried risotto before. I have nothing to compare it to so keep that little gem in mind when Reading this review.
 The recipe was easy to follow, the ingredients were easy to find . It tasted really good with the chicken thighs.
 I would not hesitate to make this again. It was creamy and the chicken was melt in your mouth.
Family loved this. Will definitely make again. BTW: If you love risotto, the Instant Pot is definitely the way to go.

OMG! this is so good! I combined this with the Instant mushroom risotto recipe on this site. So easy and SO good! Make sure to put the rosemary in (from the mushroom risotto recipe) it really adds to the dish!
